title: Drawing, "Clock case"
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457e)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. A circular frame is inscribed into a square; it has on top a base upon which a putto sits carrying a balance, and is supported by two sitting, winged sphinxes, turned outwards. Below is a base. Above at right strokes.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Clock case".
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1895.
